preprocessing module

Author:

Alpha Team Group Project

Date:

March 2023

Purpose:

Preprocess the datasets and create generals NetworkX graphs

preprocessing.convert_to_DiGraph(multi_graph)[source]
Function:

Create a DiGraph from a MultiDiGraph with the same nodes and edges containing the sum of the weights,

and conserving the first edge’s attributes :param multi_graph: NetworkX MultiDiGraph :type multi_graph: NetworkX MultiDiGraph :return: NetworkX DiGraph :rtype: NetworkX DiGraph

preprocessing.convert_to_undirected(g_directed)[source]
Function:

Convert a DiGraph to an undirected graph using NetworkX to_undirected() function

Parameters:

g_directed (NetworkX DiGraph) – NetworkX DiGraph

Returns:

NetworkX Graph

Return type:

NetworkX Graph

preprocessing.create_multi_DiGraph_railway(network, station_id)[source]
Function:

Create a MultiDiGraph from the railway dataset JSON object

Parameters:

  • network (dict) – JSON object of the railway dataset

  • station_id (dict) – Dictionary of station id per location

Returns:

NetworkX MultiDiGraph

Return type:

NetworkX MultiDiGraph

preprocessing.create_temporal_subgraph(networkGraphs, start_time, end_time, step)[source]
Function:

Create a temporal subgraph from a NetworkGraphs object using the start_time, end_time and step parameters

Parameters:

  • networkGraphs (NetworkGraphs) – Custom NetworkGraphs object

  • start_time (int) – Start time of the temporal subgraph

  • end_time (int) – End time of the temporal subgraph

  • step (int) – Step size of the temporal subgraph

Returns:

List of NetworkX DiGraphs

Return type:

list

preprocessing.preprocess_crypto(filename_: str)[source]
Function:

Preprocess the crypto dataset and return a NetworkX DiGraph and MultiDiGraph

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path to the crypto dataset

Returns:

List of NetworkX DiGraph and MultiDiGraph

Return type:

list

preprocessing.preprocess_custom(filename_: str)[source]
Function:

Preprocess the custom dataset and return a NetworkX DiGraph and MultiDiGraph

Dataset must have the following columns:

  • from: Source node

  • to: Target node

Dataset could have the following columns:

  • weight: Edge weight

  • start: Start time of the edge

  • end: End time of the edge

  • color: Color of the edge

  • lat1: Latitude of the source node

  • lon1: Longitude of the source node

  • lat2: Latitude of the target node

  • lon2: Longitude of the target node

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path to the custom dataset

Returns:

List of NetworkX DiGraph and MultiDiGraph

Return type:

list

preprocessing.preprocess_mtx(filename_: str)[source]
Function:

Preprocess the mtx dataset and return a NetworkX DiGraph and MultiDiGraph

Parameters:

Returns:

list

preprocessing.preprocess_railway(filename_: str)[source]
Function:

Preprocess the railway dataset and create NetworkX graphs

filename (str) – Path to the file (csv)

Returns:

NetworkX graphs (DiGraph and MultiDiGraph)

list of NetworkX graphs
